climbs.name: Saddle Sores
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, DC and Anders Zway 2012

content.description: Climb three bolts through blank-looking gray limestone to a ledge.  Pull a powerful, delicate sequence that leads to a small overhang.  Skirt this roof to the left.  Finish with delicate but easier climbing to the anchors.  This route is less sustained than most on the wall.
content.protection: 18 bolts to leaver biners.  A 70m rope is required.
content.location: This route is on the right side of the prow.  It is left of 'Don't Disrespect The Cattle' and two to the right of 'Morning Mate'.

content.description: Start up the ramp towards the Rough Rider Terrace  ledge following the rightmost bolt line. Climb through a steep section with pockets that leads to a stretch of cool sidepulls/laybacking. Ease onto lower angle terrain and enjoy the climbing through nice blue stone covered in tiny sea shells.
content.location: Rightmost route on Cowtown Buttress (far left side of Rough Rider Wall). Starts up the ramp that leads to the left side of the Rough Rider Terrace  ledge.

climbs.name: Mustn't Grumble
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, TB and Mark Hathaway 2010

content.description: This thing stays on you and saves the best for last.  Pulling the bulges gets you some nice exposure and fun climbing.
content.location: Just left of Morning Mate.  Start left of the boulder that separates the Main Rough Rider Wall with the N. Buttress.

climbs.name: Morning Mate
climbs.fa: R. James, Aaron Carter, Lukas Anaya and Erik Hamilton 2010

content.description: Crux it out on the enticing arete that splits the rough rider wall and the north buttress. Flow up another 30 feet to a small dihedral and roof feature. Crux it out again over this and then cruise it to the anchors. A stellar route - poised to be a classic! Thanks Aaron for putting in the time and work to put this one up!
content.location: This route climbs the prow exactly between the rough rider wall and the north buttress.

climbs.name: Horsewhipped
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Erik Hamilton and Brent Bingham 2010

content.description: Another endless pitch on the Rough Rider Wall.  It just goes on and on then you have the second half.  Really good climbing on rock that gets the forearms warm but still allows recovery along the way.
content.location: Just to the right of Morning Mate (Mahtay).

climbs.name: Don't Disrespect The Cattle
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Lukas Anaya and Ron Roah 2010

content.description:
This route climbs mild terrain for three or four bolts to a ledge.  From here employ delicate movement with stemming to overcome the crux.  Midway through rest at an in-cut before jutting up and left.  Ascend the final section with technique and opposing forces for a beautiful finish. 

  This route was named after a discussion the first ascentionist had with the rancher.  The rancher said there were two rules: "Close the gate and don't disrespect the cattle".
content.protection: 15 bolts to biners.  This route may require a 70m rope.
content.location: "Don't Disrespect The Cattle" is three routes to the right of "Morning Mate".  "Horsewhipped" is to the immediate left and "The Barn Door" is to the immediate right.

climbs.name: Chimera
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, DC and Josh Levy 2012

content.description: Start in dihedral goes out roof trending right. The back left. Nice and long good addition to North Butt.
content.location: First line to the left of 'Mustn't Grumble'. Start in a dihedral.

climbs.name: Barn Door
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, TB and Mark Hathaway 2012

content.description: A little confusing which route you are on at the bottom then gets thin just before the lower angle stuff.  A little gym tape would help.
content.location: Just right of Don't Disrespect The Cattle.

content.description: This sector has an excellent grade range, as well as some long routes. The wall is generally less steep than its neighbors, but the routes make up for it with sustained, technical climbing. Since this sector is actually more of a buttress, it gets sun earlier than the Rough Rider Wall. This feature can help on a cold day, but when it’s warm, you will want to hightail it for the shade. Also, this area gets more air flow than either the North Buttress or the Rough Rider Wall, so beware of windy days.
